name: Hot and Numbing Sichuan-Style Turkey Salad
description: Toss leftover Thanksgiving turkey with a Sichuan-inspired "strange flavor" dressing for a turkey bang bang salad that will jolt you out of any lingering food coma.
recipeIngredient: 2 teaspoons (4g) black or white sesame seeds, plus more for garnish, toasted
2 tablespoons (30ml) homemade turkey or chicken stock, or store-bought, low-sodium chicken stock, plus more as needed
2 tablespoons (30ml) white sesame paste, preferably Chinese, but tahini will do in a pinch
1/4 cup (60ml) chili oil with sediment (see note)
1 pound (450g) leftover roast turkey breast, pulled
4 scallions (60g), thinly sliced on a sharp bias, divided

recipeInstructions.text: Using a mortar and pestle, grind Sichuan peppercorns into a coarse powder, about 30 seconds. Add garlic, ginger, sugar, and sesame seeds, and pound to a rough paste, about 1 minute. Add vinegar, stock, sesame paste, and soy sauce, and pound to a smooth paste, 15 to 30 seconds. Stir in chili oil and sediment.

In a medium bowl, toss turkey with dressing and 3/4 of scallions until turkey is well-coated, adding extra stock as needed if turkey is too dry. Season to taste with salt. Transfer turkey a serving bowl or individual serving plates, sprinkle with remaining scallions, more toasted sesame seeds, and additional chili oil if desired. Serve immediately.
